para.text: If you would be running on a case-insensitive server you could force the RDD to create an index by replacing the
function in your SqlDbProvider method with
In that case the following SQL statements would be generated
CREATE INDEX CUSTOMER_NAME ON CUSTOMER (LASTNAME, FIRSTNAME)

para.text: For a DBF workarea you could achieve the same results (assuming the INVOICE_NO field has a size of 10 and 0 decimals) by using the index expression

. This is because VO will read the Field Size and Decimal information from the DBF when indexing and will generate as string of 10 characters and without decimals. You should not rely on this when indexing a SQL environment. One way to get around that without changing your sourcecode would be to replace the
but a similar replacement for the field size will be much more difficult.
